text: Python -- How do you view output that doesn't fit the screen?
I should say I'm looking for a solution to the problem of viewing output that does not fit on your screen.
For example, range(100) will show the last 30ish lines in your terminal of 30 height.

text: I am only looking to be nudged in the right direction and am curious how you guys have approached this problem.
What have you done when you run into a situation where you wish you could conveniently scroll through some large output?
Best Answer
Use the scrollback buffer on your terminal.
If you're using GNU Screen, it can be set with defscrollback 1000 or any other number in HOME/.screenrc.
Use Ctrl-a, [ to enter copy mode

code:
j -    Move the cursor down by one line
k -    Move the cursor up by one line
C-u -  Scrolls a half page up.
C-b -  Scrolls a full page up.
C-d -  Scrolls a half page down.
C-f -  Scrolls the full page down.
G -    Moves to the specified line
